batchTrade((string,address,uint256,addre.details: Each trade is executed sequentially against its specified exchange.      ETH may be sent with this transaction if needed by a trade.

params._batchTradeConfig: A config struct defining error-handling and fee-check behavior. Requirements: - Caller must have approved sufficient token allowances for all `from` tokens. - `minToReceiveBeforeFees` must be respected for each trade. - If `_batchTradeConfig.revertOnError` is true, any failed trade reverts the entire batch. Emits: - Implementation-specific events for executed trades (not defined at the interface level).
params._trades: An array of `Trade` structs describing each trade to execute.

batchTrade((string,address,uint256,addre.notice: Executes a series of trades in a single batch.
